Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebking22
Reviews.Content: The location and price cannot be beat at this hotel! You are literally walking distance to everything and several metro stops, the roissybus at the opera that takes you directly to/from the airport for 10 euros. The owners are incredibly warm and friendly. Fresh baked pastries each morning makes it feel like you are staying in someone house rather than a hotel. Not to mention jams that are made from the owners orchard. The jams are delicious and I looked forward to them every morning. The rooms are small (by large American standards), but this is Paris- so all room are small. But in every way this hotel is the ideal place to stay. I spent 5 nights there and after the first night I felt very at home. There is also a friendly little dog named Tokio- who will make sure you eat all your food. Even though the hotel is in the heart of paris (1 minute walk to the Madeline, 5 minute walk to the Concorde, 10 minutes to the opera, Les Halles) the street becomes totally silent at night.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scotstripper
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with delightful friendly staff and a fantastic location in the centre of Paris. Reasonably priced for Paris too. Ten minutes walk from the Roissybus stop at Opera, five minutes to the Madeleine metro station which goes everywhere and within easy walking distance of the big shops, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and good restaurants. Despite its central location the street was quiet and we slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for visa application”
Reviews.Author: X R
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris recently for the visa application and stayed at the Hotel La Sanguine. It was chosen due to its convenient location, cost, and the reviews avaiable here. The staff are indeed very friendly and helpful, as indicated by some of the previous reviews. The room was typically compact (for a single visitor) but very comfort and clean. The area was pretty safe as evidenced by the policemen on duty for various consulates around. Just a side note, there is a post office (La Poste) just around the corner and the staff there are familiar with the topics for the visa fee and envelope - this is a great help for some one like me who do not speak French.

Reviews.Title: “Emplacement fantastique et personnel fantastique”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: At first quite a small room and a lot of stairs to the 4th floor, however the most amazingly friendly staff and fantastic service. Very helpful and knowledgable. Fantastic location right in the centre of Madeline. Close to the Louvre, Obelisk and the river Seine. Wonderful restaurants close by and easy walk to supermarkets, shops and a short walk to most attractions. Would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. I LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “step into travel heaven”
Reviews.Author: kygogirl
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris enhanced by the family atmosphere at the Sanguine. This is the most ideal location in all of Paris. Nearby restaurants of all degree of stars,ideal shopping variety,safe walking neigborhood, and hotel staff that instantly becomes family. Only steps to the first Lauduree! Think of a true Paris experience when staying here because space is minimal, but the convenience more than makes up foir the lack of extra square feet. Great start to each morn with the tasty and elegant breakfast spread. Excellent tips on sightseeing from the staff. No finer concierge in Paris than Nicole! Zagat dining within walking distance like Sederens, Tante Louise, and the always busy soup, salad and sandwich place directly across the little street. Easy access to Diet Coke for those of us who value it. Staff replenishes your fridge daily with it at reasonable price. This place satisfies the traveler and does leave money for those treasures you must bring back home.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki S
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at La Sanguine for 3 nights as it was recommended by a friend. Without having been to Paris before we were worried about staying in a safe area. I would highly recommend it's location. It was a very safe area and was within walking distance to all of the main tourist attractions. The shops in the area are fantastic, and we enjoyed dining at a lot of the restuarants that were nearby. The people who run the hotel were fantastic and were very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but it had everything we needed and was always very clean! I will definitely be staying there when I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not my favorite location”
Reviews.Author: Dee_dreaming
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Hotel La Sanguine in Paris. The hotel is nicely fitted out and newly renovated, especially the bathroom. The staff are very friendly, the breakfast nice. We had a very small room - and I mean VERY small. Definately no room for 2 medium suitcases. We booked the cheapest room they had. I believe the more expensive rooms are a bit bigger. But the price was quite high for the bigger rooms. There is no lift but the staff helped carry suitcases upstairs. The room was airconditioned (and we needed it in July) but the airconditioner was a bit noisy. The location is good for walking to the Tuilleries gardens, Louvre, Opera Garnier and other right Bank attractions but it was really a commercial area, with none of the little cafes and patisseries that you expect in Paris. We were there over a weekend, and there was virtually nothing open in the area. I prefer to stay on the Left bank where we have stayed twice before and where you find more activity and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Reasonable to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bamberg28
Reviews.Content: Our last four night were spent in this hotel. We had a nice room even though there are stairs involved and the first night the air conditioning didn't work well. By the second day, it was fixed. The people there are friendly and warm. It is in the Madelaine area of Paris and close to everything. We even saw the end of a fashion show near by this hotel. There is a small grocery nearby to put things in your fridge. The breakfast there is typical with croissant, rolls, fruit, and coffee. The price of the hotel was very reasonable for Paris. If we came back, we would stay there. We have many places that we want to go to.....

Reviews.Title: “small hotel in great location, quiet, friendly great 2 star.”
Reviews.Author: Karenb001
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. We needed a quiet hotel close to the Grand Palais for the Monet exhibition, in early January. La Sanguine provided small comfortable rooms. They were also cosy and warm. Stairs are not a problem for us, so the absence of a lift is not an issue. The staff were very helpful and their excellent English made up for our just passable French. This is a 2 star hotel and a very good 2 star hotel .If you are looking for large rooms and all the decor of the boutique / 4+star hotels then don't expect a small 2 star Parisien hotel to fulfil that expectation. Breakfast, as in most French hotels is overpriced compaired with lunch menus- but that is France. Having said that, the continental breakfast at La Sanguine was good. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for tourists, wonderful staff, spotless, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: ozbozos
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at La Sanguine and loved it. The 8th Arrondissement area is quite upmarket, and perfectly situated for having a good look around Paris. The manager, Jean-Patrick, was charming and took all our bags upstairs without hesitating. He was also a very amusing man, and his English is probably better than mine. The rooms are small, but we had no trouble keeping our bags out of the way and us out of the way of the bags.. The rooms are very comfortable, very clean and extremely nicely furnished. Our room had a stunning bathroom, recently upgraded, and carefully designed to utilise the space adequately and well. We had decided to travel without a laptop (big mistake) but the Hotel La Sanguine has a system whereby you borrow a laptop from them for half an hour and use wireless in your room. For no charge. That was enough to do the online check in for our departure and it was the icing on the cake for us. The breakfast was a very cheerful event, as well. We are not 5 star hotel people, and probably never will be irrespective of economics. We firmly belive these small, well situated, and comfortable hotels are the best way to travel because of their (usually!) innate friendliness. This one wins hands down. La Sanguine has no lift, which may not be good for anyone with a disablity, but with only three floors and a helpful staff this poses no problems for the more fortunate others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing people and great location...”
Reviews.Author: dreamseeker13
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with 3 other friends for holiday and we stayed here. Let me summarize my review in point form as follow: - The staff are amazing. They are very nice, informative, helpful and accomodating - The hotel is located walking distance from metro (either Madeleine station, or Concorde station) - There are many great cafes and restaurants nearby, feel free to ask the hotel staff, they will be more than happy to recommend places to eat, they will even make reservation for you should you need their help. - The room is small, but for the price we paid and the excellent service we had, the room size didn't really matter at all - There is no lift in the hotel, so you got to prepare to carry your own luggage up the stairs - You can try the hotel breakfast which cost only 10 to 13 euro, they also sell a very nice Bordeaux wine for 7 euro a bottle. - Look for Madame Nicole or Madame Josephine, they are really nice ladies and if you love dog, they have a cute dog named Tokio. If you are looking for a simple hotel with great service and hospitality, I strongly recommend this place. It felt like we stayed in a local Parisian home with a local family, who happen to speak perfect English.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hyeana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a quiet side street, so sleeping was no problem! It was easy to find and to walk to from Madeline underground. The location is great as it is very central, and you can walk to Le Louvre as well! What really made my stay was the staff. The were lovely to talk to and put a smile on my face every day! They went out of their way and beyond to help me and gave me all the information that I needed to have a great time in Paris. The rooms are small but they were comforatble and it added to the charm of the place!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Gingin5356
Reviews.Content: We would always stay at this hotel, having had multiple stays here already. The staff are so so friendly, we travelled with 2 other couples and were totally satisfied with our rooms, we are under no illusions as to the size of hotel rooms in Paris, or anywhere else in Europe for that matter, so the room size was not a problem. Location couldn't be better, we do a lot of walking so absolutely ideal for us. AND a member of this family is a fan of the All Blacks. Thanks to all the Staff for our wonderful memories of your hotel. We;ll be back one day, soon. Agree no lift but wouldn't deter us.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location .....but”
Reviews.Author: Janbru_8
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, Place De Madelaine, you can walk to most things or the Madelaine train station is about 150mtrs from this hotel.The rail system in Paris is fantastic and very inexpensive. Now the Hotel La Sanguine, it is a small boutique hotel, no lift no lounge area and you eat a boutique breakfast in the small reception area, breakfast consists of some pastries, orange juice (packet type) tea or coffee and you pay extra above your room rate for this. We had the largest room in the hotel even this was tight, the hotel is very clean and the towells smell fresh and are soft. This hotel is really just for sleeping, the staff are very friendly and always greet you with "bonjour" . My wife and I discussed if we would stay at this hotel again and we agreed that we would as we are not ones for staying in, we like to get out We found an inexpensive breakfast place that has fresh fruit, cereal and natural juices about a 5min walk away, so one day we hope to go back to Hotel La Sanguine. Janbru Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile - a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: MBW-Sydney
Reviews.Content: I travel to Europe 3 or 4 times a year on business & when in Paris normally stay at the Hyatt Madeleine (which incidently, is a great choice). On my most recent stay in Paris, I had a free weekend prior to my flight back to Sydney & so as I was paying & travelling by myself, decided to find more modest digs for my two nights in town! After reading the reviews on this website for La Sanguine & given its location in Madeleine, I decided to give it a try. La Sanguine is certainly not five-star, but neither does it pretend to be. The rooms are very cosy & reasonably modest, but very clean & equipped with a/c & cable TV etc. I had a lower floor room (3rd floor) which was one of the larger rooms as I discovered when seeing some of the others being cleaned. My recommendation is certainly to go for the larger / bath tub lower floor rooms as they are still very compact but given the lack of an elevator in the hotel, made carrying luggage up & down to the room a little easier. The real star of the show at La Sanguine however is the service. I travel a lot & normally stay 5 star & can tell you that the quality of service is rarely, if ever, at the standard of La Sanguine. You really do feel as if you are personal house guests & are always treated with genuine warmth delivered with a smile. All the staff speak English and like nothing more than to have a chat or provide advice about activities or getting around town. The Madeleine location is also perfect for those travelling for pleasure & looking to explore either via the Metro or the 5 minute walk to Concorde / Champs Elysees etc. Like any big European city, hotel rooms are normally big on cost & small on size. La Sanguine may also be small, but absolutely makes up for it with good value & excellent people. While I'll still stay at the Hyatt Madeleine for work, I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending La Sanguine for travellers to Paris with better things to spend money on than overpriced hotel rooms! A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely owners!”
Reviews.Author: mimiNaperville_IL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at La Sanguine exclusively for the past 8 years, having had 2 bad experiences when they were full. I have also recommended this hotel to friends & family, they fell in love also. Yes, the rooms are small (this is Paris), but the owners & their daughter are so wonderful, & the rooms so spotless, we couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anne071
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good position and the staff were very friendly but I certainly would not recommend it for a family. We had been travelling around Europe for 4 weeks and had 3 large suitcases.........and nowhere to put them in this very small room.(And there was no lift) The heating was stiffling..............summer pjs with the window open in the middle of a european winter....................it was the only way to be remotely comfortable. The beds also were rock hard. The bathroom was very dated . Overall this hotel would be fine for a couple or a single but definately not for any more than 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: Clydeview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Sanguine for 6 nights on business at the beginning of November and had the same warm hospitality as I always get at this hotel. The first 4 nights I was on business and my husband joined me at the weekend. The staff at the hotel could not be friendlier and gave me one of the newly refurbished rooms on floor 4 right at the top of the hotel. Josephine the receptionist is lovely and so friendly to everyone, and the couple who own the hotel are adorable and welcoming. Although compact, the room was very comfortable with an excellent little shower room and a flat screen tv with ample channel choice. Paris is a wonderful city to visit and La Sanguine is in the perfect location for making your way around all the best sights. The metro stops of Madeleine and Opera are within about 5 minutes walk and these are good stops for linking up with the rest of the metro. The hotel is right next to the financial district and the Faubourg St Honore with all the designer shops and boutiques. The Champs Elysees is about 10 minutes walk and some of the most chic bars and restaurants are only a couple of streets away. It is unusual to find a hotel which is clean, friendly, cosy and with a good breakfast at under 150 Euros in Paris. I think I paid 124 Euros a night and this is fab value for what you get. I would wholeheartedly reccommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris for business or pleasure. For sure, it's not 5 star with all the deluxe trimmings and marble everywhere,but for people with a budget in mind, you couldn't do much better.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean yet parisian”
Reviews.Author: nirdo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via e-mail after reading a recommendation in a magazine. It was not our first choice but many other hotels were fully booked for this period, months ahead, so it was a nice surprise to find a very friendly person responding quickly, efficiently paying attention to our special requests. When we got to the hotel we found the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice and exceptionally clean. It was awfully small, and we still had to put in an extra bed for a child, but we expected that and were not disappointed. The room was equipped with cable TV, an A/C unit which was not required at the time we stayed but could be very valuable during the summer, and it seemed that there was high speed internet connection and apparently a way to use the TV as a computer, though we didn’t try. We had a very nice time in Paris, the hotel location is very central, close to a metro station serving 3 lines, which BTW has an elevator and is quite convenient with luggage or for people with disabilities. We would love to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Josephine , management & staff location”
Reviews.Author: athold
Reviews.Content: From the first phonecall from Australia to enquire about the accomadation , Josephine the English speaking receptionist was the person every hotel should have for none french speaking tourists. Friendly where every guest I witnessed was treated like a long time friend . Josephine faxed all relevant info for booking plus 3 alternative transport directions to and from the airport , which for a first time visitor is essential . The Management and staff ever so helpfull , from booking us into Moulin Rouge , confirming and check in online for our flights and allways greeting us with friendly conversation . We stayed floor 2 with a room facing the street , Although we have not stayed in Paris previously , the room size for Paris quite large from what we have read .Comfortable and clean with a lovely Paris outlook . Location is as good as any up to 5 star .Place De Madeline 100 metres from hotel making every löation we wanted to visit walking distance or BIG BUS ride away . In conclusion if we visit Paris again this will be our choice of stay We will also be recommending to our other friends visiting , the place to stay La Sanguine for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing best location and value”
Reviews.Author: calmkey
Reviews.Content: I can easily understand why this small two star hotel had once made it to the top ten among members. It is less than a hundred yards from the Place De Madelaine, and for those readers who know Paris, that it an excellent location. The rooms are not that large, the towels could be thicker, and there is no elavator for the three floors(staff will help with luggage), and those are the downside. The rest is more than adequete and an absolutely great value. A hidden gem with an extremely helpful staff and a good breadfast. The street is rather quiet and make sure you try to avoid staying in the room on the same floor as the receptionist area. I have stayed in five star hotels and this property is more than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights three nights at the La Sanguine at the start of our honeymoon. We had had the hotel recommended to us and weren't disappointed. Our room was small, but was comfortable and spotless. The service and staff were fantastic - we felt very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfasts were delightful with home baked pastries. One afternoon, the proprietor brought us out some pain au chocolat straight outof the oven. Delicious. The location is unbeatable. Highly recommended and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly as Advertised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from a Friday to a Thurs. at the beginning of June and although check in wasn't until the afternoon they were more than happy to accomodate myself and my wife for an early morning check in (10AM) by getting our room ready ahead of time which only took about 10minutes. The entire staff morning and night are very friendly so no need to worry about unhelpful or rude parisian staff. The location is absolutely fantastic so would have to say that you can't beat the central location of the hotel especially if you're interested in checking out sites related to the DaVinci Code (note that Jean Cocteau was a former patron of the hotel!). Finally the only negative feedback I would have to say is that our room was opposite the front desk and although I was happy with the entire room, cleanliness etc. I would recommend staying on the other floors to avoid hearing folks checking in/out in the morning and night. Note that there is only one room in this situation and the staff had asked if I wanted to change rooms but seeing as I had finally settled into my atmosphere (I have trouble sleeping in new locations so nothing to do with the hotel itself) I opted to not change rooms. Overall would recommend and note that when comparing hotels on this site this is a way above average 2star locale!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice, convenient, comfy”
Reviews.Author: Jen J
Reviews.Content: Location good, AC cold, beds comfy, street quiet @ night, owners friendly and breakfast yummy. . Hot chocolate, chocolate croissants, fresh bread, and good coffee! Not too expensive for us and our two teenagers in two rooms, esp. for the area. Refrig in room was nice, esp. once we found a little store around the corner to get water for .75 instead of 2.0 or 3.0 from the mini bar. Close to opera Metro so we walked with luggage to get to airport. Only a couple of things missing: little courtyard/ garden to sit in and relax over coffee, and an ice machine, something Europeans don't seem to need. :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, good location, but room was too small”
Reviews.Author: kitrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Sanguine. We were looking for small hotel experience, family-run, clean, quaint, very "Paris". After reading the reviews, we found the Sanguine. We found alll those things, but our room was just way too small, probably about 3x3 meters, including the bathroom. I assume that this room was once without bath, which would have been manageable, but for two people it was too small (I literally had to lie on the bed or go in the bathroom, while my wife was getting dressed.) The view was an air shaft. We had a fourth floor room (no elevator). The fourth floor ceiling are only about 7 feet high while the lower floor seemed more reasonable. There was one very strong a/c which worked great, but it was noisy and hard to adjust in such a small room, it was great to cool down the room, but we certainly couldn't sleep with it at night. The bathroom was tiny, with a shower curtained stall shower. On the other hand, the entire hotel was incredibly clean, the staff was very nice. We had breakfast one morning, and the owners told us about the special jam and fruits. There was always someone at the desk. The hotel is a couple hundred meters from the Madelaine Metro stop, which was great, but because of 7 crosswalks took at least 5 minutes to walk to. The neighborhood is very upscale and we walked to lots of places like the Place de la Concorde, Tueleries, Orangerie, Opera, all less than 10 minutes. I feel bad writing what is a somewhat negative review, I imagine if we had gotten a bigger room, on floor 2 and 3, we would have been a lot happier, but was told on booking that they were not available. I do wonder about that, since we never saw more than a dozen others altogether during the 3 days were there. But we didn't get such a room, so I have to base my review on what we experienced. Also, according to price list, these rooms were significantly more expensive. Our only other experience in Paris was a 4 star hotel that we got at a discount which didn't have the character of this hotel, the location, the ambience, but our room was beautiful, at least 3 times the size and we paid about the same rate. Perhaps, if someone insists on a larger room on a lower floor for a lower price, I could recommend this hotel, but otherwise I could not. I wanted to take some pictures of the room, but couldn't find a place to stand far back enough in the room to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: “Just all right for price and location”
Reviews.Author: tahiti05
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous poster that the hotel is about average and does not really merit a place in the top 10 list of paris hotels. We stayed for 3 days at the hotel and enjoyed very much the convenient location (2 min walk to Madeleine subway stop and walking distance to Champs Elysees and Place de la Concorde). The owners were generally nice but the service wasn't anything too special. Our room on the 4th floor was cramped and small (yes it is true that most Paris rooms are small) but it felt a bit like an attic room. The bathroom was decently clean but there were a lot of cracks in the tiles. The good thing is plenty of hot water, the A/C worked well and they have internet access. We also stayed one night in Hotel de Fleurie in the 6th arrondisement and although it is more expensive we loved it and recommend it over Hotel La Sanguine.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not worth a a #5 on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed after reading the rave reviews on trip advisor. Our room was small and basic smelled like smoke even though it was non-smoking. The properties and staff were unfriendly and kept to themselves. However, the location cannot be beat--I loved being less than a five minute walk to the Place de la Concorde. I think the #5 rating on trip advisor is solely based on location and price—the hotel and its staff are not worthy of this rating on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deroc
Reviews.Content: The location, on the right bank in the 8th arrondissement just next to the border of the 1st, is really fantastic. It is walking distance to Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysées, Louvre, Seine, and many great brasseries and restaurants. We arrived late on a Sunday night, before May Day, a holiday in Europe. We did not get a very warm reception. I mention the holiday to say that we were not greeted by the propriotors and we did not see them until the third day due to the holiday. We got a non-smoking room, number 306, and it seemed as if the previous guest had disregarded that notice. We got to open our windows, the weather was great, so the smell dissipated quickly, but it returned every time we returned to the room after being outside for a while. Mold. There was a bit in our bathroom. It was on top of the toilet tank and on both sides of the shower curtain rod, where it attaches to the wall. I maintain that I got sick because of it, but it could have been the smoke in the room. We never ate the breakfast at the hotel (it wasn't included in the price) so I can't comment on that. I can not believe Hotel La Sanguine is a top 10 hotel in Paris. It is #7 on TripAdvisor as I write this review.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Sanguine
HotelInfo.Address: 6 rue de Surene | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
